Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION  - Delivered by: Abdelrahman Badawi, Muslim American Society Youth Center, located at 1933 Bath Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11214.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Brannan.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Abdelrahman Badawi, Muslim American Society Youth Center, located at 1933 Bath Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11214.

Council Member Brannan moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 11, 2018 be adopted as printed by Council Member Lander.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Lander moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 11, 2018 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Items.AgendaNote: MESSAGES & PAPERS FROM THE MAYOR - None

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Items.AgendaNote: COMMUNICATIONS FROM CITY, COUNTY & BOROUGH OFFICES

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendations of the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2019 for non-payment of taxes on real estate and for the discount rate to be allowed for early payment of real estate taxes for Fiscal Year 2019, pursuant to the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: NYC Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendations of the interest rate to be charged for FY'19.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application No. C 150348 ZSM shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 85 Mercer Street, Manhattan (C 150348 ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Rosenthal:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 158 West 72nd Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community District  7, Council District 6, Application No. 20185267 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 158 West 72nd Street, Manhattan (20185267 TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON CIVIL SERVICE AND LABOR

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to health insurance coverage for surviving family members of certain deceased employees of the department of transportation
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Health insurance coverage for surviving family members of certain deceased employees of the DOT.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United State Supreme Court to protect public sector collective bargaining in Janus v. American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME).
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member formally noted his abstention to vote on this item: Council Member Ulrich

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: US Supreme Court to protect public sector collective bargaining in Janus v. American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME).

Items.Title: Resolution acknowledging workers’ gains through the American labor movement.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Acknowledging workers’ gains through the American labor movement.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at one-half of one percent per annum for Fiscal Year 2019.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at one-half of one percent per annum for FY'19.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 7 percent per annum for Fiscal Year 2019 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than $250,000, or not more than $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 7% per annum for FY`19 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than $250,000, or not more than $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18 percent per annum for Fiscal Year 2019 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 18% percent per annum for FY'19 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report on procedures following receipt of a notice of misconduct about an employee of a school bus vendor
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to report on procedures following receipt of a notice of misconduct about an employee of a school bus vendor.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating an electronic tracking system for city-issued parking permits
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creating an electronic tracking system for city-issued parking permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the placement of street name signs at intersections
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Placement of street name signs at intersections.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting by the department of education of complaints and investigations relating to school bus transportation services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Reporting by the DOE of complaints and investigations relating to school bus transportation services.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Disclosure of service fee charges associated with tickets to entertainment events in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating expanded polystyrene as recyclable and repealing sections 16-324(f) and 16-329 of the administrative code of the city of New York
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Designating expanded polystyrene as recyclable and repealing sections 16-324(f) and 16-329 of the administrative code of the city of NY.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Misuse of city-issued parking permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department, the 311 customer service center, and the New York city taxi and limousine commission to collect and report disaggregated data on sexual harassment and sex offenses

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of correction to report on sexual abuse.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to eliminate the disparity in compensation paid to teachers, staff and directors at community-based EarlyLearn NYC centers, as compared to the compensation paid to Department of Education instructors for similar employment.

Items.MatterName: Eliminate the disparity in compensation paid to teachers, staff and directors at community-based EarlyLearn NYC centers, as compared to the compensation paid to DOE instructors for similar employment.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Suspension of alternate side of the street parking rules on streets within a five block radius of street resurfacing projects.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Developing and publishing a comprehensive plan regarding the distribution and use of city-issued parking permits.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to enforce Chancellor’s Regulation A-801, which requires that students on school buses wear seat belts until the bus comes to a destination stop.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requires that students on school buses wear seat belts until the bus comes to a destination stop. (A.801)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a pilot program for issuing warning notifications for first-time offenders of certain litter laws
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Establishing a pilot program for issuing warning notifications for first-time offenders of certain litter laws.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report annually on officer resignations prior to becoming eligible for retirement with pension
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the PD to report annually on officer resignations prior to becoming eligible for retirement with pension.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to notify incarcerated individuals and their legal representatives when an incarcerated individual is held solely due to a bail amount of less than $10
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of correction to notify inmates, defense attorneys, and court personnel when an inmate is detained solely on a bail amount of one dollar.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting on-call scheduling for utility safety employees and providing advance notice of work schedules to utility safety employees
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting on-call scheduling for utility safety employees and providing advance notice of work schedules to utility safety employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certification of safety training for street permits
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring certification of safety training for street permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a school diversity monitor within the human rights commission
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Creating a school diversity monitor within the human rights commission.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to dedicated heat inspections and the installation of temperature reporting devices in certain multiple dwellings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Dedicated heat inspections and the installation of temperature reporting devices in certain multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the department of education associate degree programs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE associate degree programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring notice of renewal of the senior citizen homeowner exemption and disabled homeowner exemption by phone
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Requiring notice of renewal of the senior citizen homeowner exemption and disabled homeowner exemption by phone.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to placing greater regulations and restraints on the creation of driveway curb cuts, and providing local community board notification
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Placing greater regulations and restraints on the creation of driveway curb cuts, and providing local community board notification.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 42 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.

The Public Advocate (Ms. James) was not present at this Meeting.

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such report which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) recessed the Meeting subject to call.
